definition: comedic material/(in reference to a person) laughingstock/butt of jokes
old variant of 笑[xiao4]
laugh/smile/CL:個|个[ge4]
material/stuff/grain/feed/to expect/to anticipate/to guess
entertaining/hilarious

sentences.english: Are you afraid of looking a fool in public - of being a subject of ridicule?
sentences.chinese: 你害怕当众出丑，成为大家的笑料吗？

sentences.english: Our employer treated our suggestion as a joke.
sentences.chinese: 我们的雇主把我们的建议视作笑料。

sentences.english: Other jokes about the award also write themselves.
sentences.chinese: 这个奖项本身就是笑料。

sentences.english: Her bad cooking has become the neighbourhood joke.
sentences.chinese: 她那糟糕的烹调技术成了邻居的笑料。

sentences.english: The great poem contributed to the gayety of the world.
sentences.chinese: 那伟大的诗篇也给了人们笑料。

definition: funny bits/humorous parts/jokes/punchline
to include impromptu comic material in opera performance (idiom); to jest/buffoonery
entertaining/hilarious
sth that people like to chat about/topic of idle conversation
to get people to laugh/funny/hilarious
silly talk or "mo lei tau" (Cantonese), genre of humor emerging from Hong Kong late in the 20th century
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
comedy/CL:部[bu4],齣|出[chu1]
to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease
to burst out laughing/hilarious/burst of laughter
leisure time (over a cup of tea, after a meal etc)
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
joke/jest/CL:個|个[ge4]/to laugh at/to mock
spoof (web-based genre in PRC, acquiring cult status from 2005, involving humorous, satirical or fantastical videos, photo collections, texts, poems etc)
humorous/jocular/zany
item of storytelling or performed dialogue (folk arts)/sketch
